page.title: 12Local History.
page.content: Architecture in Middleham. Earliest buildings are close to the Castle & date back to the 16th & 17th centuries. They are a row of cottages, the end one having once been a bakery. Several cottages have large stone blocks outside their doors; probably castle stonework. The houses behind the Black Bull are thought to be built of castle stone. Castle Cottage has a lintel dated 1671. Stable Door Cafe has a stone marked 1682. During the 18th Century several large stone houses were built for the notable race horse trainers: Manor House,Neville Hall & Glasgow House are all imposing and impressive.The Methodist Sunday School is dated 1836; Jubilee Fountain 1887;Town Hall 1862; Old School 1869; New School 1977 & the most recent buildings are the Council houses at the Springs built in 1982.
